entities.description: An act involving threats or coercion.
The criminal act of deliberately setting fire to property.
The practice of obtaining something, especially money, through force or threats.
Illegal entry into a building with intent to commit a crime, especially theft.
The act of stealing from someone's pocket.
The act of taking a purse or bag from someone by force.
The act of stealing goods from a store.
Stealing items from within a structure or building.
Stealing items from a motor vehicle.
The criminal act of stealing or attempting to steal a motor vehicle.
The action of forging a document, signature, or work of art.
Wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain.
Offenses related to the illegal possession, distribution, sale, or manufacture of narcotics.
The act or practice of engaging in sexual activity for payment.
The trade of humans for the purpose of forced labor, sexual slavery, or commercial sexual exploitation.

relationships.description: Both entities involve stealing items, one from buildings and the other from motor vehicles.
Narcotic violations can involve the possession or use of drug equipment.
Extortion can result in fraud when threats or coercion lead to wrongful financial gain.
Human trafficking can facilitate activities such as prostitution.
Forgery is a type of fraud.
